module_functions.py

pages.modules._module_functions.get_module_figs()[source]

Create plant module-specific images.

Returns:

A list of charts that can be displayed using st.plotly_chart().

Return type:

list

pages.modules._module_functions.get_required_data_S(measuring_list, units)[source]

Retrieve the required data names and their possible units for this system component. This function provides a dictionary where keys represent the names of data variables relevant for this system component. Each key is mapped to a list of possible units in which that data variable might be recorded.

Parameters:

  • measuring_list (list) – List of names for the data variables relevant for this system component.

  • units (list) – List of possible units for the data variables.

Returns:

A dictionary where keys are the names of data variables and values are lists of possible units.

  • keys : strings Representing the names of data variables required by this component.

  • values : lists of strings Representing the possible units for the respective data variable.

Return type:

dict

pages.modules._module_functions.get_sankey_mapping_S(measuring_list, Consumption, labels, types, energy_type_inputs, energy_type_outputs)[source]

Create a data mapping dictionary from lists of labels, types, energy_type_inputs, and energy_type_outputs.

Parameters:

  • measuring_list (list) – List of data series in the DataFrame.

  • Consumption (list) – List of consumption values corresponding to each data series in the DataFrame.

  • labels (list) – List of labels corresponding to each data series in the DataFrame.

  • types (list) – List of types corresponding to each data series in the DataFrame.

  • energy_type_inputs (list) – List of energy type inputs corresponding to each data series in the DataFrame.

  • energy_type_outputs (list) – List of energy type outputs corresponding to each data series in the DataFrame.

Returns:

The data mapping dictionary.

Return type:

dict

pages.modules._module_functions.initialize_data_interface()[source]

Initialize the data interface based on the saved interface in Configuration.json.

Returns:

Returns an instance of the saved data interface, or None if the saved interface could not be loaded.

Return type:

obj or None

Notes

The function dynamically imports the ‘api’ module and creates an instance of the saved data interface.

pages.modules._module_functions.load_module_data(data_mapping, module_names, start_time=None, end_time=None)[source]

Load data for specified modules from the API and interpolate missing values.

Parameters:

  • data_mapping (dict) – The data mapping dictionary.

  • module_names (list) – List of module names for which data should be loaded.

  • start_time (str or datetime, optional) – The start time for data retrieval.

  • end_time (str or datetime, optional) – The end time for data retrieval.

Returns:

A DataFrame with the actual data from the API.

Return type:

pd.DataFrame

module_template.py

Template for Module for Handling Energy System Parameters

This module-template outlines various parameters and options for the energy system model.

param - units:

A list of strings corresponding to units supported by the pint module (Pint Documentation). These units are used for presenting options to the user and must be compatible with the measures in the module.

  • Example: units = ["W", "kW", "Wh", "kWh", "J", "°C", "K"]

param - measuring_list:

Contains the names of the measures used in this system module, forming the basis for the Sankey diagram.

  • Example: measuring_list = ['transported_energy_IN', 'room_OUT_2']

param - measuring_list_sankey:

A list that includes both measured and calculated values for the Sankey diagram. Units must be appended to calculated values.

  • Example: measuring_list_sankey = ['transported_energy_IN', 'room_OUT_2', "MATHTEST_[W]"]

param - Label:

Describes the measured or calculated values in the Sankey diagram. If shorter than measuring_list, missing labels won’t be displayed.

  • Example: Label = ['transported_energy_IN', 'room_OUT_2', "MATHTEST"]

param - Consumption:

Initially set to None. Updated during processing to contain keys, numerical values, or complex expressions.

  • Example:

    • Consumption = [None, None, "Compressor_Power + ambient_heat_IN"]

    • Consumption = [None, None, "IF( battery >= 0, battery, 0 )", "IF( battery <= 0, battery * -1, 0 )"]

param - Type:

Each label must have a corresponding type: Source, Transformer, or Sink.

  • Example: Type = ['Transformer', 'Sink', 'Sink']

param - EnergyTypeInput:

Indicates the form of incoming energy. ‘-’ is used for flows not represented.

  • Example: EnergyTypeInput = ['electricity', 'heat', 'heat']

param - EnergyTypeOutput:

Indicates the form of outgoing energy. ‘-’ is used for flows not represented.

  • Example: EnergyTypeOutput = ['heat', '-', '-']

param Special Handling of Consumption:

param ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~:

param 1. Conditional Statements:

Converts IF-THEN-ELSE to Python’s ternary operator.

param 2. Tokenization:

Breaks down expressions into tokens.

param 3. Data Retrieval and Caching:

Fetches and caches data for non-operator, non-numeric tokens.

param 4. Token Replacement:

Replaces tokens with cached values.

param 5. Expression Evaluation:

Evaluates updated expressions.

param 6. Unit Conversion and Update:

Converts results to desired units and updates the Sankey diagram.

param .. note:::

Following these steps enables the Sankey diagram to represent both simple and complex energy flows comprehensively.

Heat_pump_module.py

pages.modules.Heat_pump_module.create_gauge_chart(value: float, title: Optional[str] = None, reference_value: Optional[float] = None) → Figure[source]

Create a Plotly Gauge Chart based on provided values.

Parameters:

  • value (float) – The current value to be displayed on the gauge.

  • title (str, optional) – The title for the gauge chart.

  • reference_value (float, optional) – The reference value for calculating the delta.

Returns:

A Plotly Figure object representing the gauge chart.

Return type:

go.Figure

Notes

The function supports optional delta and threshold settings based on the reference value.

pages.modules.Heat_pump_module.get_module_figs()[source]

Create plant module-specific figures.

This function must be customized for each plant module and retrieves data from an external API.

Returns:

A list of Plotly figures which can be displayed using st.plotly_chart().

Return type:

list

Notes

This function specifically handles HP-specific power rating calculations. It uses the data_interface for data retrieval.

Create plant module-specific figures.

This function must be customized for each plant module and retrieves data from an external API.

Returns:

A list of Plotly figures which can be displayed using st.plotly_chart().

Return type:

list

Notes

This function specifically handles HP-specific consumption and degree of autarky calculations. It uses the data_interface for data retrieval.

Battery_module.py

pages.modules.Battery_module.create_gauge_chart(value: float, title: Optional[str] = None, reference_value: Optional[float] = None) → Figure[source]

Create a customized Plotly Gauge Chart.

Parameters:

  • value (float) – The current value to be displayed on the gauge.

  • title (str, optional) – The title of the gauge chart.

  • reference_value (float, optional) – The reference value for calculating the delta.

Returns:

A Plotly Figure object representing the gauge chart.

Return type:

go.Figure

Notes

The function includes various settings for customizing the gauge, such as tick positions, colors, and threshold settings.

Return type:

list

Notes

This function specifically handles battery charging status calculations. It uses the data_interface for data retrieval.
